This weekend, I would like a journal about the BOOKAWEEN day (if you were absent, you can write a general journal. Sample Journal Last week was Bookaween at MCA, and it was such an exciting time with the 3-1 class! Our class made a book called, and we presented it to everyone on the big stage. I felt a little nervous at first, but it was also exciting to perform. The gym was filled with bright lights, colorful costumes, and loud cheers‚Äîit felt like being in a real theater! After the presentations, we had lots of fun activities. We tossed rings, made Halloween crafts, and played outside in the cool, fresh air. The laughter and music made it feel like a big festival. The sweetest part of the day was when Principal Ms. Ryu gave us candy. It tasted as sweet as success after all our hard work. My cheeks were sore from smiling, and my hands were sticky from crafts, but my heart felt happy and proud. Bookaween with 3-1 was an amazing day full of fun, color, and teamwork. I‚Äôll never forget how great it felt to share our story with everyone! Reminder! Remember to log into Khan Academy and Readworks a few times a week!

World Heritage Day ‚Äì Parent Notice Dear Parents, Today I sent home a letter about our World Heritage Day event, which will take place on Thursday, November 20. Please check your child‚Äôs bag for the letter and return the food donation form by Wednesday, November 13, if you would like to participate. Our class (3-1) will represent Ireland, and parents are invited to prepare one Irish dish to share (approximately 5‚Äì6 servings). Here are some Irish food ideas you can choose from: Mashed potatoes Potato pancakes (Boxty) Irish soda bread (with butter or jam) Scones Shortbread or butter cookies Apple cake or apple tart Irish sausages (small pieces or mini sausages) Mini shepherd‚Äôs pie cups Cheese and crackers (Irish cheddar if available) Green cupcakes or snacks to show Irish colors Thank you very much for your support and for helping make our World Heritage Day a special experience for the students. ‚Äî Mr. Smith
